has_weakly_initial_of_weakly_initial_set:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr∏ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/

/-- If `C` has (small) products and a small weakly initial set of objects, then it has a weakly initial
object.
-/
theorem has_weakly_initial_of_weakly_initial_set_and_has_products [has_products.{v} C] {ι : Type v} {B : ι → C}
    (hB : ∀ A : C, ∃ i, nonempty («expr ⟶ » (B i) A)) : ∃ T : C, ∀ X, nonempty («expr ⟶ » T X) :=
  ⟨«expr∏ » B, fun X => ⟨«expr ≫ » (pi.π _ _) (hB X).some_spec.some⟩⟩
#align
  has_weakly_initial_of_weakly_initial_set_and_has_products has_weakly_initial_of_weakly_initial_set_and_has_products
has_initial_of_weakly_initial_and_has_wi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr𝟙» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr𝟙» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/-- If `C` has (small) wide equalizers and a weakly initial object, then it has an initial object.

The initial object is constructed as the wide equalizer of all endomorphisms on the given weakly
initial object.
-/
theorem has_initial_of_weakly_initial_and_has_wide_equalizers [has_wide_equalizers.{v} C] {T : C}
    (hT : ∀ X, nonempty («expr ⟶ » T X)) : has_initial C :=
  by
  let endos := «expr ⟶ » T T
  let i := wide_equalizer.ι (id : endos → endos)
  haveI : nonempty endos := ⟨(«expr𝟙») _⟩
  have : ∀ X : C, unique («expr ⟶ » (wide_equalizer (id : endos → endos)) X) :=
    by
    intro X
    refine' ⟨⟨«expr ≫ » i (classical.choice (hT X))⟩, fun a => _⟩
    let E := equalizer a («expr ≫ » i (classical.choice (hT _)))
    let e : «expr ⟶ » E (wide_equalizer id) := equalizer.ι _ _
    let h : «expr ⟶ » T E := classical.choice (hT E)
    have : «expr ≫ » («expr ≫ » («expr ≫ » i h) e) i = «expr ≫ » i ((«expr𝟙») _) :=
      by
      rw [category.assoc, category.assoc]
      apply wide_equalizer.condition (id : endos → endos) («expr ≫ » h («expr ≫ » e i))
    rw [category.comp_id, cancel_mono_id i] at this
    haveI : is_split_epi e := is_split_epi.mk' ⟨«expr ≫ » i h, this⟩
    rw [← cancel_epi e]
    apply equalizer.condition
  exact has_initial_of_unique (wide_equalizer (id : endos → endos))
#align has_initial_of_weakly_initial_and_has_wide_equalizers has_initial_of_weakly_initial_and_has_wide_equalizers
